de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IFwUpdGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IFwUpdGroup

  • public class IFwUpdGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing methods for firmware update.
    Description
    This class realizes the nested interface with methods for firmware update for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the IFwUpd member of ReaderModule.
    NOTE: It is strongly recommended to read and follow the instructions in the Application Note N60810-e-ID-B.pdf

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LOGGING_OFF
      Option-ID for selecting additional options
      Description
      The update is executed and no logfiles are generated.
      static int LOGGING_STANDARD
      Option-ID for selecting additional options
      Description
      The update is executed and a standard logfile is generated.
      static int LOGGING_WITH_PROTOCOLS
      Option-ID for selecting additional options
      Description
      The update is executed and an additional logfile with exchanged protocols is generated.

    • Method Detail

      • getModuleVersion

        public java.lang.String getModuleVersion()
        Request version number of firmware update library
        Returns:

      • startUpdateSilent

        public int startUpdateSilent(java.lang.String xmlFwPathname,
                             int logOption,
                             java.lang.String logDir,
                             IFwUpdListener listener)
                      throws FeException
        Method to execute a firmware update
        Parameters:
        xmlFwPathname - Firmware pathname (path and filename). Firmware files are XML files and available from FEIG ELECTRONIC
        logOption - Logging option
        logDir - Optional destination path for log files
        listener - (optional) listener class in application, which must be derived from IFwUpdListener
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description
        The update is executed in silent mode with optional update messages reflected with a listener.
        Different logging options can be enabled:
        a) no logging: set logOption = LOGGING_OFF
        b) standard logging: set logOption = LOGGING_STANDARD (this option is recommended)
        c) standard logging and additional protocol logging: set logOption = LOGGING_WITH_PROTOCOLS
        NOTE: Before the use of this update method, the connection to the Reader must be established and the Reader Information is read with IInfoGroup.readReaderInfo().

        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • verifyFile

        public int verifyFile(java.lang.String xmlFwPathname)
               throws FeException
        Method to check the compatibility of firmeware file with the connected Reader
        Parameters:
        xmlFwPathname - Firmware pathname (path and filename). Firmware files are XML files and available from FEIG ELECTRONIC
        Returns:
        status 0 if OK
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description
        This method checks the compatibility of an XML firmware file with the connected Reader.
        It is preconditioned that the Reader is connected and the Reader Information is previously read with IInfoGroup.readReaderInfo()

        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getFileInfo

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getFileInfo()
        Method to query version numbers of each controller firmware, embedded in the XML firmware file
        Returns:
        List with version numbers of each controller firmware, embedded in the XML firmware file
        Description
        This method returns a map with version numbers of each controller firmware, embedded in the XML firmware file.
        It is preconditioned that the Reader is connected and the compatibility of the XML firmware file is checked with verifyFile(java.lang.String)
        The returned hash map contains in the key string the controller type ("RF-Decoder", "RF-Controller", "AC-Controller", "Bootloader", "Keyboard", "Ext. SCR", "WLAN Module") and in the value string the version number in the format "xx.yy.zz".

        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
